citations.narrative:
In early July 2025 a cohort of 26 non-human primates were moved into a new group housing enclosure, and on 11 July
the animals let themselves out. The enclosure design was initially insufficient to contain the animals, even when the door
was locked and needed to be modified. All animals were contained in the secondary containment and none of the animals
were injured in the incident. Primary enclosures must be constructed and maintained so that they contain the non-human
primates securely and prevent accidental opening of the enclosure, including opening by the animal.
Corrected at the time of inspection, 18 September 2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the site manager.
n

narrative:
3.80(a)(2)(iii) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
In early July 2025 a cohort of 26 non-human primates were moved into a new group housing enclosure, and on 11 July 
the animals let themselves out. The enclosure design was initially insufficient to contain the animals, even when the door 
was locked and needed to be modified. All animals were contained in the secondary containment and none of the animals 
were injured in the incident. Primary enclosures must be constructed and maintained so that they contain the non-human 
primates securely and prevent accidental opening of the enclosure, including opening by the animal. 
 
Corrected at the time of inspection, 18 September 2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the site manager. 
 
 n
